column4: n8of9: I used the System->Administration->Shared folders, it installed Samba for me, changed my Workgroup to "Workgroup" to match my Windows box, then added my folder. I restarted samba with sudo /etc/init.d/samba restart and now i can't even see my windows shares, though I could before
running winXP?
This box is edgy if it matters
it may matter (at least to me), as i haven't yet run edgy
are you trying to connect to your windows shares using Places>Connect to Server...?
I'm using Places->Network Servers, then clicking on "Windows Network", before this I could access my windows share right in Network Servers, there was no "Windows Network"
should "dns proxy" in smb.conf be set to yes?
i like frogzoo's idea... can you take a look at your smb.conf to see if maybe samba is trying to be a master browser?
im in smb.conf, where should I look for master browser?
'dns proxy' is 'yes' by default.  check the 'domain master' setting.
'dns proxy' is no by default for me, I just removed samba completely, then reinstalled, the default smb.conf has it set to no
domain master is set to auto, but it is commented out
please paste the contents of smb.conf to http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/38192/
k, give me a couple misn
ok, two things: 1> under Authentication, 'security = user' should be unchecked
2> you have no shares set up from your linux box, but you were just trying to see windows shares, right?
so remove the ';' from the Security = user line?
correct
you'll then have to restart the samba service and try again
alright, i'll try it
still no Windows share showing up
good luck. sorry i couldn't be of more help
